title: Mattie Stewart
text:
Matthew James Stewart (born 18 May 1973) is a former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, who gained 34 caps as a prop for <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a> (1996–2002).
Early life.
Stewart was born on 18 May 1973 in <a href="Dartford">Dartford</a>, <a href="England">England</a>.
Rugby career.
Stewart’s first international appearance was against <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a> at <a href="Murrayfield">Murrayfield</a> on 14 December 1996. He was a <a href="Lance%20corporal">Lance Corporal</a> physical training instructor in the British Army at the time.
He returned to start for Scotland in February 2000 against Italy. He went on the <a href="2002%20Scotland%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20North%20America">2002 Scotland rugby union tour of North America</a> where <a href="Ian%20McGeechan">Ian McGeechan</a> tried playing him at loose head against <a href="Canada%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a>.
His last cap was against <a href="Romania%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Romania</a> at Murrayfield on 9 November 2002, coming on as a late replacement.
He played 169 matches for the <a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton Saints</a> between 1997 and 2003 during which time he scored five points for the club. Whilst at Northampton he started in the victorious <a href="2000%20Heineken%20Cup%20Final">2000 Heineken Cup Final</a> as they defeated <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a>.
He played two matches for <a href="Barbarian%20F.C.">Barbarian F.C.</a> in 1994.
